description: The U.S. could be drawn into a conflict between China and the Philippines that's been roiling the South China Sea.
title: South China Sea conflict near Philippines could be next U.S.-China flashpoint

description: In an interview with 60 Minutes, Cillian Murphy speaks candidly with Scott Pelley about his life and work.
title: Cillian Murphy on acting and his first reaction to "Oppenheimer" script

description: In some states, overturning Roe v. Wade has impacted health care for women, regardless of whether they are pregnant.
title: How strict abortion bans impact women's health care

description: 3D printing startup co-founder Jason Ballard explains how he thinks 3D-printed houses will transform construction jobs and resist the effects of climate change.
title: Can 3D-printed homes weather climate change?

description: While reporting on the tensions between China and the Philippines in the South China Sea, 60 Minutes was on board as a Philippine ship was rammed — then surrounded — by larger Chinese vessels.
title: Rammed and surrounded by Chinese ships at sea

description: A Texas company — driven by a mission to create faster, better and more affordable housing — is 3D printing homes. It's also working with NASA to 3D print on the Moon. Lesley Stahl reports.
title: Company 3D prints houses on Earth, partners with NASA for moon project

description: "Oppenheimer" star Cillian Murphy pulled back the curtain to talk about his approach to acting.
title: Cillian Murphy on his preparation, instinct he uses when acting

description: When it comes to wine and whiskey – especially bourbon – the oak barrel reigns, not just as a container, but also for the magic that the wood gives to the whiskey.
title: Bourbon barrels flavoring scotch, tequila and rum around the world

description: In Texas, where strict laws ban abortion with limited exceptions, women are struggling to find quality reproductive health care. Some doctors say the state law is dangerously vague.
title: Doctors fear Texas' strict abortion laws put pregnant women in danger

description: A Texas company — driven by a mission to create faster, better and more affordable housing — is 3D printing homes. It’s also working with NASA to 3D print on the Moon. Lesley Stahl reports.
title: 3D printing a 100-home community in Texas, and someday on the moon | 60 Minutes

description: “Oppenheimer” star Cillian Murphy pulled back the curtain to talk about his approach to acting.
title: Cillian Murphy: The 60 Minutes Interview

description: When it comes to wine and whiskey – especially bourbon – the oak barrel reigns, not just as a container, but also for the magic that the wood gives to the whiskey.
title: Inside the booming, bourbon-driven barrel business | 60 Minutes

description: In Texas, where strict laws ban abortion with limited exceptions, women are struggling to find quality reproductive health care. Some doctors say the state law is dangerously vague.
title: The unintended consequences of Texas' strict abortion laws | 60 Minutes

description: The U.S. could be drawn into a conflict between China and the Philippines that's been roiling the South China Sea.
title: U.S. could be drawn into clash between Philippines, China as tensions rise | 60 Minutes

description: Leonard Lauder, the oldest son of the founder of Estée Lauder and a longtime former CEO of the beauty empire, has died at 92, the company said in a statement.
title: Leonard Lauder, son of Estée Lauder founders and ex-CEO, dies at 92

description: Browse all of our full episode transcripts from 2025 of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan."
title: Read full episode transcripts of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" from 2025

description: Democratic Sen. Alex Padilla of California was briefly detained last week after being forcibly removed from a news conference by Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem.
title: Padilla warns about what happens "when cameras are not there" after Noem event

description: Flash flooding caused by torrential rains on Saturday killed at least three people in northern West Virginia. Officials said 2.5 to 4 inches of rain fell within about half an hour.
title: Flash floods kill 3 in West Virginia, several people missing

description: The Israelis had the opportunity to assassinate Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and President Trump conveyed to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that it wasn't a good idea, one U.S. official told CBS News.
title: Trump opposed Israeli plan to kill Iran's supreme leader, CBS News sources say

description: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, Sens. Tom Cotton and Alex Padilla join Margaret Brennan.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," June 15, 2025

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," as Iran and Israeli strikes continue for the third day, Holly Williams and Debora Patta join with the latest from the Middle East. Plus, Sen. Alex Padilla joins days after he was briefly detained by Homeland Security officers.
title: 6/15: Face the Nation

description: The conflict between Israel and Iran entered uncharted territory as the two rivals warned that the worst could still come after multiple days of airstrikes. Debora Patta reports from Tel Aviv and Holly Williams has the latest from Iraq's border with Iran.
title: Conflict between Israel, Iran enters uncharted territory as two rivals warn more could come

description: As airstrikes continue between Israel and Iran, Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas, the chair of the Senate Intelligence Committee, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that President Trump has "been very clear that all options remain on the table to defend our own people, to support Israel."
title: Sen. Tom Cotton says Trump has "made clear" that the U.S. backs "Israel to the hilt"

description: Democratic Sen. Alex Padilla of California, who last week was briefly detained after being forcibly removed from Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's press conference, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "if that's how this administration responds to a senator with a question, don't just imagine what they're capable of, but what they are doing when the cameras are not there, to people without a title like United States senator."
title: Padilla warns about what happens "when cameras are not there" after removal from Noem event

description: Democratic Sen. Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut and Republican Sen. Lindsey Graham join "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" for a rare bipartisan interview after they cosponsored legislation to put secondary sanctions on Russia. Blumenthal said he is calling on President Trump to "show leadership" and call on the Senate to take up the legislation.
title: Sen. Richard Blumenthal says Trump should "show leadership" on Russian sanction legislation

description: Hosted by Jane Pauley. In our cover story, David Pogue looks at the legacy of singer-songwriter, activist and father Harry Chapin. Plus: David Martin examines the origins of the U.S. Army as it marks 250 years; Tracy Smith explores the allure of auto racing with Indy Car team co-owner David Letterman; Mo Rocca discusses a biography of entertainer Desi Arnaz, who co-starred with wife Lucille Ball in the classic sitcom “I Love Lucy”; Patrick Gaffigan offers his thoughts on his dad, comedian Jim Gaffigan; and Conor Knighton learns the magic behind “worm grunting.”
title: 6/15: Sunday Morning

description: Missed the second half of the show? Sens. Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut and Lindsey Graham of South Carolina give a rare, joint bipartisan interview and Sen. Alex Padilla also joins.
title: Face the Nation: Blumenthal, Graham, Padilla

description: At least two people died and 32 others were injured after a bridge collapsed over a river in India's western Maharashtra state, sweeping others into the water.
title: 2 dead, 32 injured in bridge collapse at tourist destination in India

description: The following is the transcript of an interview with Sen. Tom Cotton, Republican of Arkansas, that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on June 15, 2025.
title: Transcript: Sen. Tom Cotton on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," June 15, 2025

description: A manhunt in Minneapolis entered its second day after Minnesota state Rep. Melissa Hortman and her husband were shot and killed while Minnesota state Sen. John Hoffman and his wife are recovering in the hospital after being shot. Gov. Tim Walz called the attack an "act of "targeted political violence." Lilia Luciano reports from Minneapolis.
title: Manhunt in Minneapolis in second day after 2 lawmakers shot in "politically motivated" attack

description: Residents of Sibley County are encouraged to lock their doors and secure their vehicles, adding that law enforcement will be going to area residences to ask to search properties.
title: Vance Boelter's car found after lawmaker shootings in Minnesota

description: The following is the transcript of an interview with Sen. Alex Padilla, Democrat of California, that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on June 15, 2025.
title: Transcript: Sen. Alex Padilla on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," June 15, 2025

description: The following is the transcript of an interview with Sens. Richard Blumenthal, Democrat of Connecticut, and Lindsey Graham, Republican of South Carolina, that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on June 15, 2025.
title: Transcript: Sens. Richard Blumenthal and Lindsey Graham on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," June 15, 2025

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," as Iran and Israeli strikes continue for the third day, Holly Williams and Debora Patta join with the latest from the Middle East. Plus, Sen. Alex Padilla joins days after he was briefly detained by Homeland Security officers.
title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," June 15, 2025

description: Security footage from the museum shows a man and a woman taking pictures while pretending to sit on Nicola Bolla's "Van Gogh" chair before breaking it.
title: Tourists break crystal-covered chair at Italian museum

description: We leave you this Sunday morning with horses, and offspring, marking Father's Day at Inyo National Forest in the Sierras of California. Videographer: Carl Mrozek.
title: Nature: Horses in the Sierras

description: The comedian's youngest son, Patrick Gaffigan, offers his take on Jim Gaffigan as a role model, and it's not pretty. Happy Father's Day. Jim!
title: How is Jim Gaffigan as a father? Hear it from one of his kids

description: The comedian's youngest son, Patrick Gaffigan, offers his take on Jim Gaffigan as a role model, and it's not pretty. Happy Father's Day, Jim!
title: How is Jim Gaffigan as a father? Hear it from one of his kids

description: If you are looking for live fishing bait, you could dig up some worms – or, you could use a bizarre trick involving vibrations to conjure earthworms out of the soil. Correspondent Conor Knighton looks into a little-understood process known as "worm grunting." He also visits Sopchoppy, Florida, the self-described "Worm Capital of the World," to attend the Worm Gruntin' Festival – a big party celebrating the town's favorite invertebrate.
title: The "magic" of worm grunting

description: Todd S. Purdum's biography explores the impact on American culture by the Cuban-born entertainer who (as husband and business partner of Lucille Ball) changed the rules of TV.
title: Book excerpt: "Desi Arnaz: The Man Who Invented Television"

description: The Cuban-born entertainer broke conventions when he co-starred with wife Lucille Ball in "I Love Lucy," playing a straight-man sitcom dad. Now, a new biography reveals his lesser-known contributions to television.
title: Desi Arnaz: Singer, husband, dad, and the man who "invented" TV

description: Desi Arnaz, the Cuban-born entertainer, broke conventions when he co-starred with his wife Lucille Ball in the TV show "I Love Lucy," playing a prototypical American sitcom dad. He also changed the rules of television by filming episodes, thereby creating the rerun – and, ultimately, a new economic model for TV. Correspondent Mo Rocca talks with Todd Purdum, author of a new biography, "Desi Arnaz: The Man Who Invented Television," about Arnaz's impact on American culture; and with Lucie Arnaz, who discusses her parents' marriage and divorce, and her father's extraordinary journey.
title: Desi Arnaz: Singer, husband, dad, and the man who "invented" TV

description: Correspondent Steve Hartman admits that he wasn't eager to become a dog dad, when his wife brought home an Australian Labradoodle. But it wasn't long before Hartman discovered a new role for himself: dog's best friend.
title: The dog that won over Steve Hartman's heart

description: Since 1996, David Letterman's racing team, Rahal-Letterman-Lanigan Racing, has won the Indianapolis 500 twice. He talks about the attraction of the sport, along with drivers Josef Newgarden and Pato O'Ward, and racing great Mario Andretti.
title: Chasing the checkered flag: The allure of Indy Car racing

description: In this web exclusive, comedian and Indianapolis native David Letterman talks with correspondent Tracy Smith about his lifelong interest in auto racing, and how he is today co-owner of an Indy Car racing team, Rahal-Letterman-Lanigan Racing. He also talks about his experience riding in a car driven by Paul Newman around California Speedway.
title: Extended interview: David Letterman on Indy Car racing

description: Legendary comedian and talk show host David Letterman is also co-owner of an Indy Car team, and since 1996, Rahal-Letterman-Lanigan Racing has won the Indianapolis 500 twice. Correspondent Tracy Smith talks with Letterman, along with drivers Josef Newgarden and Pato O'Ward, and racing great Mario Andretti, about the attraction of the sport; the dream of winning the Indy 500; and how the popularity of Indy Car racing is accelerating.
title: The allure of Indy car racing

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at the legacies of two musical giants – the beating hearts of Sly and the Family Stone and the Beach Boys.
title: Remembering Sly Stone and Brian Wilson

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at the legacies of two musical giants – the beating hearts of Sly and the Family Stone and the Beach Boys.
title: Passage: Remembering Sly Stone and Brian Wilson

description: On June 14, 1775, the Continental Congress voted to replace the colonies' part-time militias with a full-time army – and after 1,300 battles and skirmishes, the Army, led by Gen. George Washington, defeated the British Empire, winning our independence.
title: How the U.S. Army was born - and a free nation realized

description: On June 14, 1775, the Continental Congress voted to replace the part-time militias that were facing off against British forces with a full-time army. After 1,300 battles and skirmishes, the Army, led by Gen. George Washington, defeated the British Empire, winning our independence. CBS News national security correspondent David Martin looks at the creation of America's unified military, and visits a National Museum of the United States Army exhibit honoring the sacrifices of our nation's revolutionary heroes.
title: How the U.S. Army was born

description: Since Friday, Israel has sent jets to bomb targets across Iran, saying its objective is to destroy as much of Iran's nuclear program as it can, with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also suggesting support for regime change. Tehran, meanwhile, has retaliated with attacks of its own. With scheduled meetings between the U.S. and Iran over that nation's nuclear program now cancelled, correspondent Elizabeth Palmer talks with Middle East expert Sanam Vakil about the unfolding conflict, and the potential consequences for the Trump Administration.
title: America's risk in the Israel-Iran conflict

description: A French tourist has been arrested in Iceland suspected of murdering her daughter and husband, local media reported.
title: Tourist reportedly suspected of murdering her family in Iceland

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at historical events on this date.
title: Almanac: June 15

description: Since his death in 1981 at age 38, the singer-songwriter's legacy has only grown beyond such emotional songs as "Cat's in the Cradle" and "Taxi," to include charities he founded to address food insecurity, while living life with a simple credo: "When in doubt, do something."
title: Harry Chapin and his impact beyond music

description: Time was short for singer-songwriter Harry Chapin. But since his death in a car crash in 1981 at age 38, Chapin's legacy has only grown beyond his emotional songs like "Cat's in the Cradle" and "Taxi," to include the charities he founded to address food insecurity. Correspondent David Pogue talks with members of Chapin's family, who discuss his impact – as a father, a fundraiser and philanthropist, and an example of how to live life, with a simple credo: "When in doubt, do something."
title: Harry Chapin: Songwriter, activist and father

description: On Saturday, Washingtonians saw a rare sight in our nation's capital: a military procession of troops, tanks, and aerial firepower, held on the 250th anniversary of the U.S. Army (and the 79th birthday of the commander in chief, President Trump). Meanwhile, across the rest of America, protesters marched in what was billed as "No Kings Day," attacking Trump's confrontational tactics. "Sunday Morning" national correspondent Robert Costa reports on the day's massive demonstrations of power – and dissent.
title: A day for a parade in D.C., and for anti-Trump demonstrations nationwide

description: There has been a rise in the threat of deportations by abusers, said Esther Limb, Immigration Practice Director at Her Justice in New York City.
title: She married a U.S. citizen. After she alleged abuse, he threatened deportation.

description: When her mother disappears, 7-year-old Nicki Bates begins a lifelong search to find her and bring her killer to justice. "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports.
title: The Day My Mother Vanished

description: One week after Daniel Green posted an image on Instagram with his new, younger girlfriend, he was shot to death in his California home by his ex-wife.
title: Did a photograph posted on social media lead to a man's death?

description: A California man shot dead in his home — his ex-wife admits she pulled the trigger. Did a photo posted on social media lead to the man's death? "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty reports.
title: The Killing of Officer Green
